intro: Napoleonaea cuneata, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Napoleonaea cuneata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to various parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
